Also in 2007, Google acquired [[Postini]]<ref>[http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2007/09/weve-officially-acquired-postini.html The Official Google Blog - We've Officially Acquired Postini]</ref> and continued to sell the acquired technology<ref>[http://www.google.com/intl/en/press/pressrel/apps_postini_20071003.html Google Press Center - Google Adds Postini's Security and Compliance Capabilities to Google Apps]</ref> as [[Google Security Services]].<ref>[http://www.google.com/a/help/intl/en/security/index.html Google - Google Security Services]</ref>
Also in 2007, Google acquired [[Postini]]<ref>[http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2007/09/weve-officially-acquired-postini.html The Official Google Blog - We've Officially Acquired Postini]</ref> and continued to sell the acquired technology<ref>[http://www.google.com/intl/en/press/pressrel/apps_postini_20071003.html Google Press Center - Google Adds Postini's Security and Compliance Capabilities to Google Apps]</ref> as [[Google Security Services]].<ref>[http://www.google.com/a/help/intl/en/security/index.html Google - Google Security Services]</ref>

===Google Books===
{{main|Google Book Search}}
{{main|Google Book Search}}
Google indexes a number of [[book]]s and reached a revised settlement in 2009 to limit its scans to books from the U.S., the U.K., Australia and Canada.<ref>{{cite news|author=Pettersson, Edvard|title=Google Wins Preliminary Approval of Online Books Settlement|url=http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=ahUxORgasDFs|publisher=Bloomberg|date=November 20, 2009|accessdate=2009-12-18}}</ref> The Paris Civil Court ruled against Google in late 2009, asking them to remove the works of La MartiniÃ¨re ([[Ãditions du Seuil]]) from their database.<ref name=Smith>{{cite news|author=Smith, Heather|title=Googleâs French Book Scanning Project Halted by Court |url=http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601087&sid=apZ3UG9CPLo8|publisher=Bloomberg|date=December 18, 2009|accessdate=2009-12-18}}</ref>
Google indexes a number of [[book]]s and reached a revised settlement in 2009 to limit its scans to books from the U.S., the U.K., Australia and Canada.<ref>{{cite news|author=Pettersson, Edvard|title=Google Wins Preliminary Approval of Online Books Settlement|url=http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=ahUxORgasDFs|publisher=Bloomberg|date=November 20, 2009|accessdate=2009-12-18}}</ref> The Paris Civil Court ruled against Google in late 2009, asking them to remove the works of La MartiniÃ¨re ([[Ãditions du Seuil]]) from their database.<ref name=Smith>{{cite news|author=Smith, Heather|title=Googleâs French Book Scanning Project Halted by Court |url=http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601087&sid=apZ3UG9CPLo8|publisher=Bloomberg|date=December 18, 2009|accessdate=2009-12-18}}</ref>
